alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Dickens (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 09 at 8:33PM CDT until April 09 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN DICKENS AND SOUTHEASTERN CROSBY COUNTIES... At 832 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles north of White River Lake, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...63 MPH wind gust measured at White River Lake West Texas Mesonet at 8:24 PM. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Spur, White River Lake and Kalgary. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. In addition to large hail, significant amounts of smaller hail are likely. Accumulating hail can cause damage to crops, trees, and vehicles.
